Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The Radar and Science Engineering Section in the Communications, Tracking, and Radar Division conducts research, development, and flight missions in the field of airborne and spaceborne remote sensing radar for NASA and other government agencies. This section specializes in systems and techniques related to synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imaging, radar interferometry, altimetry, Earth and planetary subsurface sounders, scatterometry, and cloud and precipitation radars.

The Section is also a leader in the area of planetary landing radars. Our radar program focuses on Earth and planetary science missions, with emphasis on first-of-a-kind radar systems and cutting-edge technology!

We seek a self-motivated individual who can work well both independently and in a team environment to function as a Group Staff Assistant II. This is primarily an administrative support position demonstrating a proven customer service orientation, phenomenal interpersonal skills and being agile and flexible in the performance of the job. 

As a member of the Section 334 Business Administration Team, you will report to the Section Business Administration Manager (BAM).  Your responsibilities include and are not limited to:

  • Providing oﬃce support to multiple technical groups within the Section, as well as providing back-up support to the Section Office and other groups as needed
  • Preparing and processing foreign and domestic travel, generating travel reports, processing affiliate badge requests for domestic and foreign visitors and escorting visitors as vital
  • P-card purchasing, requisitions and iProcurement orders including ordering office supplies
  • Coordinating meetings via Outlook, maintaining conference room schedules, arranging conference calls via Teams
  • Assisting with preparation of presentations, graphics, and website inputs, including proofreading and editing
  • Assisting with office moves and new hire preparations
  • Assisting with offboarding actions including clearing checkpoints
  • Updating Work Authorization Memos (WAMs)
  • Coordinating on-site and off-site workshops
  • Assisting with the coordination of candidate interviews including but not limited to preparing interview schedules, etc.
  • Assisting with property inventory
  • Providing paper and electronic timecard assistance
  • Alternate safety Floor Warden
  • Demonstrating a solid customer service orientation, great organization skills, and ﬂexibility in the performance of the job
  • Prioritizing work and completing assignments accurately and in a timely manner
  • Regularly supporting multiple and multifaceted ad hoc assignments

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a High School diploma with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; Associate degree with a minimum of 1 year of related experience; related required training.
  • Solid understanding of general job aspects speciﬁcally in the secretarial/administrative support profession with strong organizational, computer and interpersonal skills
  • Detailed understanding of oﬃce procedures and oﬃce automation applications: MS Oﬃce, Word, Excel, Power Point, Adobe Acrobat, Outlook and applies knowledge and skills in this area
  • Strong meeting planning and scheduling skills
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure on multiple sophisticated tasks, and work independently with minimal direction to meet commitments with delivering high quality products
  • Willingness to learn new technologies and tools to enhance and/or improve oﬃce procedures and processes
  • Motivated self-starter who takes the initiative to establish and implement process improvements
  • Ability to evaluate situations and apply good judgement in any vital resolution
  • Team player with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to interact effectively with all levels of personnel and provide excellent customer service
  • Exercise proper discretion when dealing with sensitive information
  • Proven success in the administrative support profession with the ability to maintain patience and composure in a dynamic work environment that includes interruptions and changing priories
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook

Preferred Skills:

  • Extensive understanding of JPL/ESD policies, procedures, and practices
  • Staff Assistant experience in a technical section office environment
  • Experience using JPL-based tools such as Concur, Service Order Modules, Timekeeping, Requisitions, P-card, UCS, WAMs, Property Manager Gateway Administrator, DocuShare, Alfresco and JPL-ID
  • Experience with the JPL-ID process and on-boarding of volunteers, affiliates, and foreign nationals
  • Experience with JPL foreign and domestic travel policies and procedures
  • Familiar with MS Project, Access, Visio, SharePoint, Photoshop, and Publisher
  • Ability to identify, learn, and apply new processes to improve oﬃce operations
  • General understanding of JPL facilities, safety, and property policies and procedures
  • Willingness to look for, learn, and apply new Information Technology (IT) tools to office procedures and processes

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
